duck: Contribution margin - In cost-volume-profit analysis, a form of management accounting, contribution margin is the marginal profit per unit sale.
Margin, Iran, a village in Qazvin Province
Gross margin - Gross margin is the difference between revenue and cost before accounting for certain other costs.
Leaf margin, the edge of a leaf blade
margin definition: the part of a page or sheet outside the main body of printed or written matter.
Margin (finance), a type of financial collateral used to cover credit risk
Profit margin - Profit margin, net margin, net profit margin or net profit ratio all refer to a measure of profitability.
Continental margin, the zone of the ocean floor that separates the thin oceanic crust from thick continental crust
Margin (machine learning), the distance between a decision boundary and a data point
Margin (typography), the white space that surrounds the content of a page
Margin (economics) - In economics, a margin is a set of constraints conceptualised as a border.

milestones: U.S. Congress passes CAFTA with 2 vote House margin
GAA: Westmeath beat Donegal by narrowest of margins
Obama projected winner in North Carolina primary, Clinton wins Indiana by narrow margin
Lebanon government wins ‘vote of confidence’
Spain edge out Saudi Arabia 1-0 in Group H
Workers at Swansea auto parts plant vote to strike
Kentucky Derby field chart
Alaska GOP calls for Begich resignation for Senate revote
Mitt Romney wins 2012 Florida primary
Bronislaw Komorowski sworn in as president of Poland
Senator Ted Stevens loses re-election bid in Alaska ballot
Australia thrash South Africa in Tri Nations rugby match
Queensland state Green party to run environmental lawyer in treasurer's electorate
United Nations Report: Deserts threatened by global warming
Halonen and Niinistö neck-and-neck heading into Sunday's run-off election in Finland
UK energy companies announce that prices for bills could increase

wiki.text:
'Margin' may refer to:

*Margin (economics) *Margin (finance), a type of financial collateral used to
cover credit risk *Margin (typography), the white space that surrounds the
content of a page *Margin (machine learning), the distance between a decision
boundary and a data point *Margin, Iran, a village in Qazvin Province
*Continental margin, the zone of the ocean floor that separates the thin oceanic
crust from thick continental crust *Marginal frequency distribution in
statistics *Leaf margin, the edge of a leaf blade *, also ID-2119, a United
States Navy patrol boat in commission from 1918 to 1919
